returns._0: True if the interface is supported, false otherwise.

checkAction(bytes32,address,address,uint.notice: Checks if the action is valid according to the policy.

getPolicyData(bytes32,address,address,ad.notice: Returns the limit and spent amount for a given token under permission, account, multiplexer.

initializeWithMultiplexer(address,bytes3.notice: Initializes the policy to be used by given account through multiplexer (msg.sender) such as Smart Sessions. Overwrites state.ATTENTION: This method is called during permission installation as part of the enabling policies flow. A secure policy would minimize external calls from this method (ideally, to 0) to prevent passing control flow to external contracts.
